OMG previews, I want gizmos now!
No! I have an exam tomorrow. I have to study! I can't afford to stay up all night watching KSP videos!

Mmmmm, videos ... Just what my bandwidth doesn't need. Thankfully, ObsessedWithKSP is doing a great job passing-on information. [A 'Marketing' company obviously can't be bothered to communicate in useful ways] http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102079-Squadcast-Summary-%28Updated-2014-12-13-the-0-90-features-video-edition%21%29
is it just me or has the yt list only one video?
Stayputnik lacking any SAS makes me sad
I love that the loading screen with the three Kerbals now has a black space sky instead of that ugly blue.

Will the ability to remove results from science parts be restricted to 'Scientist' Kerbals similar to the pilot limitations?

So you a non scientist Kerbal could run an experiment, but then it could only be recovered with the vessel, while a Scientist could pull that data off and store it in the command pod (allowing reuse for things like the thermometer, accelerometer etc)

Is it just me, or is a link to the playlist missing?

It is here!

Thanks for the corrected link. Hopefully a mod will fix the first post shortly, as presently it only links to a single video.

Love all the information, can't wait to play!

I haven't seen the new big wheels, are they ready yet?

Also, what about repairing things? it'd be nice to have a video or some more detailed explanations.

I haven't seen the new big wheels, are they ready yet?

Also, what about repairing things? it'd be nice to have a video or some more detailed explanations.

Exactly. I'm happy with being able to embed the current gear into the body of the craft now that we've got gizmos, but it'd be nice to get a little more info on both of these things.

From the .90 Trailers and YouTubes, I have to say this update seems so promising. I mean the editor overhaul alone just blows me away. EVERYTHING that needed to be in there was added, from an extremely awesome way to sort, to adding the ability to select a root part, to being able to switch between symmetry and mirror, and even local part adjustment and root adjustment.

As a soon to be BETA game and even in the Alpha phases, Squad, you have made a game that outshines most completed games. And I have to give you props, and let you know how amazed I am at how well you guys have handled this game. More developers should look at the way you have developed this game and learn, because I have been here since about .13, and its been one heck of a ride. Please continue to add more awesome things and make the game even better. I would hope now that you consider the scope complete, besides refinements that we can expect other cool things to be added as well?

Among my personal list would be for;

-RPM and MFD to be integrated into stock, since they offer SO MUCH to IVA only flights

- KAS to become stock since it offers a lot on the space construction side of things (Attaching and detaching)

- If there is going to be an update of the aerodynamic model (I believe you have mentioned how the current is placeholder) I would hope Procedural Fairings would be integrated as well since it offers so much even without the aerodynamic model for those who wish to have realistic looking type rockets

and more. But even if it doesn't get added, that's what mods are for, and I can live with that. Thank you for being such a transparent and consistent developer.

Edited December 15, 2014 by SpaceSmith

Very happy with the update as well.

I'm very hyped about the new biomes personally as I love exploring every corner of every planet/moon.

Now I'll get 'rewarded' for it and it's so nice.

This game really is amazing for a pre-beta game (and early beta once 0.90 hits)

As for personal list...

- I just wish we'll get stable 64bits and no lag from 500-1000 parts tho. I know these things are in development, and will get there eventually. But in the meantime I am at a point in my KSP gaming where I hit that limit on a regular basis. Tonight was building a Jool-5 ship, not too much parts (around 550) and already 2sec RL time for each game second.

- An electric propeller part.

Well... I saw that the Stayputnik can't hold attitude. This isn't that much of a problem normally, but if you look at when you unlock it in the tech tree, chances are you will have at least a level 1 pilot, probably a 2. This defeats the purpose of the probes. The probes are supposed to be an option where if you are flying a high-risk mission, and your pilots took a while to get to say... Level 2, that you would rather take so as not to risk your pilot. But if the Stayputbik can't hold up to kerbals that are level 1, there's no point. Not to mention that the Stayputnik has stay put in its name. That should apply to attitude as well.

Unless you're moving the probes around the tech tree.

They actually added new loading screen pictures?! I guess to make up for the longer loading times that this update will bring...

more content = longer load. No avoidance of that!
I am very curious as to how expensive/high level probes are before they get SAS. This will require a serious retooling of my strategies, as I use unmanned flight whenever it is feasible.

I really can't wait for the update so I can build bases in all the new biomes! Also, was it just me or was that a turbojet

on Eve?
